The Numidians in fact had been only employed to divert the attention of the cavalry on the lest Roman wing, whilst Hasdrubal destroyed the Roman right, who were crushed in between their own centre and the river. As soon as he has destroyed the Roman right, he passes behind the centre of the battle and crushes the left wing under Varro.
